intro: Packera bolanderi var. harfordii, commonly known as Harford's brittle bladder, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It features heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
